hint.text: In running back and forth between any two points, the total distance covered is 2 times the distance between the points.

solution.text:
Taking the distance covered in running back and forth between initial position and marker1 as \(a_1=2*_{j}_\)
distance between consecutive markers is _{k}_
increase in the distance covered in the second round; \(d=2*_{k}_\)
\(a=_{{2*j}}_\), \(n=_{l}_\) and \(d=_{{2*k}}_\)
using the formula \(S_n=\frac n2[2a+(n-1)d]\)
\(S_n=_{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(j*2)+(l-1)*(k*2))}}_\)
The total distance covered between initial position and _{l}_ markers is _{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(j*2)+(l-1)*(k*2))}}_ metres

content.text:
In shuttle run drill, a player requires to run back and forth between initial position and markers.
The 1st marker is placed at _{j}_metres from the initial position, second at _{{j+k}}_metres, 3rd at _{{j+(k*2)}}_metres,and so on.
If there are _{l}_ such markers in this drill, find the total distance a player runs between initial position and markers?
